comment:
Another "90" eh? 

Nose is vanilla and sweet sherry. There's a bitter oak note here as well, a bit off putting and giving me lingering feelings of young raw whisky. I even get what could be a hair of banana. 

Taste - Citrus fruit, creamy milk chocolate, some dark fruits, spices, and young oak on the back end. 

Overall this is a pretty run of the mill NAS sherry whisky. I think the casks are decent. The ABV is a really nice place where I think most will be able to go right in drinking but adding water is perfectly acceptable as well. Yes it's a bit sparky and young, but it's 75 bucks and I think it's hitting a sweet spot between the spice and sweet notes. 

2 stars, very average whisky. I think those who enjoy younger whisky will find this more like a 3 star and the price while I would still say it is a bit high it's getting hard to be critical of a bottle at an ok proof, with sherry casks, under 100 bucks today.

향 : 옅은 알콜향, 빨간건과일, 보리곡물향
맛 : 쉐리 < 스파이시 강조, 미들 오일리, 깊은 쉐리도 아닌, 온전한 플로랄도 아닌, 
피니쉬 : 약간 더 알콜향, 마른오크통

전체적으로 알콜향이 조금 더 느껴져서 아쉬운 느낌, 맥캘란과 글렌고인의 아쉬운 점 그 중간 어디쯤..

Very rich
One of the great sherried whiskey
Quick hit review number 4. Nice drop, nothing outstanding. Seemed younger than the age statements but well balanced and lovely aftertaste. Reasonably priced at $65 USD.

Nose: Floral and sweet, but too overpowering. A touch of wood. Sharp on the end.

Palette: Burnt butter? 

Finish: Honey and citrus. Alcohol lingers. 

A nice but not exemplary whisky. As it is a NAS, it still seems young and would have benefitted from a bit more maturation.

I am always on the lookout for a solid well Sherried Whisky and was intrigued when this one first popped up at my local Costco. It's typically priced for between $90-$100 in my market so when Costco dropped the price to $59.99 I decided there was enough value to pull the trigger on it. 
Now I personally have never had anything from Glenrothes so I had no frame of reference for what to expect, but let's dive into what we know about this specific bottle:

1) It's an NAS release (according to friend who got info from a distributor it's believed to be around 16yrs old)
2) It's bottled at an interesting 48.8% abv
3) It's exclusively aged in first fill ex-sherry casks 
4) It's non chill filtered and natural colour (really nice colour on it too)

Let's dive into the tasting:

Right upon entry you know you are dealing with a quality and classic sherried whisky. Plums, raisins, orange peel and dark chocolate covered peanuts. It's really mouthcoating and has a lovely oily texture. Mid palette adds tobacco, oak spice and leather. Finish is long with the heat kicking in with a cherry cake, spiced raisins and a good dose of oak. It's mouthwatering. Really easy to drink! I love the proof they selected as I think it's perfect for this dram. 

From a comparison standpoint it think this one is better then both the Aberlour A'bundah and the Oloroso Nadurra. It's got a good amount of complexity and for the price I paid I think it's an excellent value. If I had paid $89.99 I would have still been happy as that's the price the aforementioned 2 go for and I prefer this one. 

I know people typically hesitate to pull the trigger on NAS Scotch releases but I would say this one is worth a try if you enjoyed heavily sherried whisky. 

Cheers all!
too much influence of the wood. there is not much left of the Glenrothes character.

Nose has scents of oak, plums and even a hint of banana. There is a bite on the tongue that is tempered with a splash of water. This brings out some fruity notes of raisins and plums. The f8nish is buttery and spicy
I get the fruity, Sherry aroma on the nose, which I like a lot.   The palate is rich and full of flavor, with a smooth follow through.  A well balance dram.
Its opened up nicely after 3 weeks. Tasty will recommend and buy again.

노즈: 버터스카치, 우디, 바닐라카라멜
팔레트 : 첫맛은 달고, 우디 스파이시함이 지나고 약간의 고소함
피니쉬: 스파이시함과 우디향이 쭉 치고 올라옴, 긴 피니쉬
Vanilla and meaty, with a sweet, medium body. Would buy again.

Nose: wood, vanilla, earthy, 

Spicy, a slight smoke, buttery, smooth

Nose: light, green apple, rubbing alcohol, vanilla, toasted bread, cantaloupe 

Palate: vanilla, short bread, cool mouth feel, slight oak, citrus, pear

Finish: woody, vanilla

Nose is sweet caramel toffee vanilla 

Palate is rich and spicey 

Finish is medium rich and continued spice

The colour on this really caught the eye. A delicious sherried speyside
2019 Advent: smells of vanilla tastes thick sherry with spices
Light and sweet nose, but a kick on the taste. Sweet fruit and spice.
Spicy. Strong. Sweet notes in the middle. Enjoyed it. Somewhat complex.
